snippet: Kobe Bryant has changed his shooting motion to compensate for a hand injury and it appeared to work in a Lakers' victory over the Rockets on Tuesday.
abstract: Kobe Bryant has changed his shooting motion to compensate for a hand injury and it appeared to work in a Lakers' victory over the Rockets on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: Kobe Bryant, the Lakers' star guard, is making some subtle changes to his shot to help his ailing right wrist. Bryant has been playing through the injury, which has been an issue since he tore a ligament Dec. 19 in a fall in an exhibition game against the Clippers. The injury did not seem significant at the time, but it has recently caused Bryant to curtail the follow-through on his shot.
